title: Buttplug Message Schema
description: The JSON Protocol format for the Buttplug Protocol.

ClientId.description: User-set id for the message. 0 denotes system message and is reserved.

ServerId.description: User-set id for the message. 0 denotes system message and is reserved.

SystemId.description: Used for non-direct-reply messages that can only be sent from server to client, using the reserved system message Id of 0.

DeviceIndex.description: Index used for referencing the device in device messages.

ClientIdMessage.description: Message types that are expected to have an Id and nothing else.

ServerIdMessage.description: Message types that are expected to have an Id and nothing else, from the server side, which may be either a reply or an event (id 0).

SystemIdMessage.description: Message sent by the server that is not in direct reply to a message send from the client, and always uses system Id.

DeviceMessages.description: A list of the messages a device will accept on this server implementation.

NullMessageAttributes.description: Attributes for device message that have no attributes.

ActuatorType.description: Denotes type of actuator (Vibrator, Linear, Oscillator, etc...)

DeviceMessagesV3.description: A list of the messages a device will accept on this server implementation.

DeviceMessagesV2.description: A list of the messages a device will accept on this server implementation.

DeviceMessagesV1.description: A list of the messages a device will accept on this server implementation.

DeviceMessagesV0.description: A list of the messages a device will accept on this server implementation.

StepCountV2.description: Specifies granularity of each feature on the device.

StepCountV3.description: Specifies granularity of each feature on the device.

DeviceList.description: List of all available devices known to the system.

Devices.description: Array of device ids and names.

DeviceAdded.description: Notifies client that a device of a certain type has been added to the server.

ScalarCmd.description: Sends a generic scalar command to a device.

Scalars.description: Device actution scalar (floating point, range can vary) keyed on acutator index, stepping will be device specific.

Scalar.description: Actuator scalar (floating point, range can vary), stepping will be device specific.

ActuatorType.description: Actuator type that is expected to be controlled with this subcommand.

SensorReadCmd.description: Sends a request to read a sensor value.

SensorReading.description: Returns from either a sensor read request or a subscribed sensor event.

SensorSubscribeCmd.description: Sends a request to subscribe for updates to a sensor value.

SensorUnsubscribeCmd.description: Sends a request to subscribe for updates to a sensor value.

DeviceList.description: List of all available devices known to the system.

Devices.description: Array of device ids and names.

DeviceAdded.description: Notifies client that a device of a certain type has been added to the server.

BatteryLevelCmd.description: Requests that a BatteryLevel be retreived.

BatteryLevelReading.description: Returns a BatteryLevel read from a device.

RSSILevelCmd.description: Requests that a RSSI level be retreived.

RSSILevelReading.description: Returns a BatteryLevel read from a device.

RawWriteCmd.description: Sends a raw byte array to a device. Should only be used for testing/development.

Endpoint.description: Endpoint (from device config file) to send command to.

Data.description: Raw byte string to send to device.

WriteWithResponse.description: If true, BLE writes will use WriteWithResponse. Value ignored for all other types.

RawReadCmd.description: Request a raw byte array from a device. Should only be used for testing/development.

Endpoint.description: Endpoint (from device config file) from which the data was retrieved.

Length.description: Amount of data to read from device, 0 to exhaust whatever is in immediate buffer

WaitForData.description: If true, then wait until Length amount of data is available.

RawSubscribeCmd.description: Subscribe to an endpoint on a device to receive raw info back.

Endpoint.description: Endpoint (from device config file) from which the data was retrieved.

RawUnsubscribeCmd.description: Unsubscribe to an endpoint on a device.

Endpoint.description: Endpoint (from device config file) from which the data was retrieved.

RawReading.description: Raw byte array received from a device. Should only be used for testing/development.

Endpoint.description: Endpoint (from device config file) from which the data was retrieved.

Data.description: Raw byte string received from device.

ServerInfo.description: Server version information, in Major.Minor.Build format.

ServerName.description: Name of the server. Can be 0-length.

MessageVersion.description: Message template version of the server software.

MaxPingTime.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) the server will wait between ping messages from client before shutting down.

DeviceList.description: List of all available devices known to the system.

Devices.description: Array of device ids and names.

DeviceAdded.description: Notifies client that a device of a certain type has been added to the server.

VibrateCmd.description: Sends a vibrate command to a device that supports vibration.

Speeds.description: Device vibration speeds (floating point, 0 < x < 1) keyed on vibrator number, stepping will be device specific.

Speed.description: Vibration speed (floating point, 0 < x < 1), stepping will be device specific.

RotateCmd.description: Sends a rotate command to a device that supports rotation.

Rotations.description: Device rotation speeds (floating point, 0 < x < 1) keyed on rotator number, stepping will be device specific.

Speed.description: Rotation speed (floating point, 0 < x < 1), stepping will be device specific.

Clockwise.description: Rotation direction (boolean). Not all devices have a concept of actual clockwise.

LinearCmd.description: Sends a linear movement command to a device that supports linear movements.

Vectors.description: Device linear movement times (milliseconds) and positions (floating point, 0 < x < 1) keyed on linear actuator number, stepping will be device specific.

Position.description: Linear movement position (floating point, 0 < x < 1), stepping will be device specific.

ServerInfo.description: Server version information, in Major.Minor.Build format.

ServerName.description: Name of the server. Can be 0-length.

MessageVersion.description: Message template version of the server software.

MaxPingTime.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) the server will wait between ping messages from client before shutting down.

RequestServerInfo.description: Request server version, and relay client name.

MessageVersion.description: Message template version of the client software.

DeviceList.description: List of all available devices known to the system.

Devices.description: Array of device ids and names.

DeviceAdded.description: Notifies client that a device of a certain type has been added to the server.

StopDeviceCmd.description: Stops the all actions currently being taken by a device.

StopAllDevices.description: Stops all actions currently being taken by all connected devices.

VorzeA10CycloneCmd.description: Sends a raw byte string to a Kiiroo Onyx/Pearl device.

Speed.description: Rotation speed command for the Cyclone.

Clockwise.description: True for clockwise rotation (in relation to device facing user), false for Counter-clockwise

KiirooCmd.description: Sends a raw byte string to a Kiiroo Onyx/Pearl device.

Command.description: Command to send to Kiiroo device.

FleshlightLaunchFW12Cmd.description: Sends speed and position command to the Fleshlight Launch Device denoted by the device index.

Speed.description: Speed at which to move to designated position.

Position.description: Position to which to move Fleshlight.

LovenseCmd.description: Sends a command string to a Lovense device. Command string will be verified by sender.

Command.description: Command to send to Lovense device.

SingleMotorVibrateCmd.description: Sends a vibrate command to a device that supports vibration.

Speed.description: Device vibration speed (floating point, 0 < x < 1), stepping will be device specific.

ServerInfo.description: Server version information, in Major.Minor.Build format.

ServerName.description: Name of the server. Can be 0-length.

MessageVersion.description: Message template version of the server software.

MaxPingTime.description: Maximum time (in milliseconds) the server will wait between ping messages from client before shutting down.

RequestServerInfo.description: Request server version, and relay client name.

RequestLog.description: Request for server to stream log messages of a certain level to client.

LogLevel.description: Maximum level of log message to receive.

DeviceRemoved.description: Notifies client that a device of a certain type has been removed from the server.

RequestDeviceList.description: Request for the server to send a list of devices to the client.

StartScanning.description: Request for the server to start scanning for new devices.

StopScanning.description: Request for the server to stop scanning for new devices.

ScanningFinished.description: Server notification to client that scanning has ended.

Ok.description: Signifies successful processing of the message indicated by the id.

Error.description: Signifies the server encountered an error while processing the message indicated by the id.

Test.description: Used for connection/application testing. Causes server to echo back the string sent. Sending string of 'Error' will result in a server error.

TestString.description: String to be echo'd back from server. Setting this to 'Error' will cause an error to be thrown.
